comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "Arthur Gordon Webster (November 28, 1863 – May 15, 1923) was the founder of the American Physical Society." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_Gordon_Webster

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Webster was appointed through the American Mathematical Society to the Naval Advisory Board which was planning to have its first meeting in October, 1915 in the office of the Secretary of the Navy in Washington. Other Board members are also in the Bain newsstream, presumably in connection with their appointments to the Board, which was to gather the finest scientific minds to advise the military on use of the latest scientific achievements . A contemporary account lists his qualifications at the time of appointment as: "Arthur Gordon Webster, Worcester, Mass, Harvard '85, Professor of physics, Clark University." books.google.com/books?id=1poSAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA371&d... More on Webster at Clark University's site: www.clarku.edu/departments/physics/history/history4.cfm See further notes and portraits of Board members under

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: B-59 and artolog:  Thanks for discovering more information on Prof. Webster.  We will include some of the info. next time we update.
